alert.note: Alert for Pribilof Islands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 2:34PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS COMBINED WITH HEAVY SNOW FOR THE PRIBILOF ISLANDS LATE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING... A compact storm system from Siberia is forecast to track across the Pribilof Islands late tonight into early Sunday morning, bringing a quick round of heavy snow and strong east-northeasterly winds gusting as high as 35 to 45 mph. Gusty winds combined with heavy snowfall may reduce visibility to one mile or less at times due to blowing snow. The worst conditions will be brief, likely lasting only a few hours around midnight tonight. This system is expected to bring 2-4 inches of new snowfall to the Pribilofs during this time. Model discrepancies have become minor, providing high confidence that this will be a quick system, however the blowing snow and reduced visibilities will still be prominent while the system moves through.
